annotations.label: Page-header
annotations.text: EN

annotations.label: Page-header
annotations.text: Official Journal of the European Union

annotations.label: Title
annotations.text: COUNCIL DECISION

annotations.label: Title
annotations.text: of 5 July 2004

annotations.label: Title
annotations.text: on the existence of an excessive deficit in Poland
annotations.translation: 关于波兰存在的过度赤字

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN UNION,

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: Having regard to the Treaty establishing the European Community, and in particular Article 104(6) thereof,
annotations.translation: 考虑到《建立欧洲共同体条约》，特别是其中第 104(6) 条的规定，

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: Having regard to the recommendation from the Commission,

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: Having regard to the observations made by Poland,
annotations.translation: 考虑到波兰提出的意见，

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: Whereas:

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (1) According to Article 104 of the Treaty Member States are to avoid excessive government deficits; this applies also to Member States with a derogation, the case of all countries that joined the European Union on 1 May 2004.
annotations.translation: (1) 根据《条约》第 104 条，成员国应避免政府赤字过高；这也适用于有克减的成员国，即所有于 2004 年 5 月 1 日加入欧盟的国家。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (2) The Stability and Growth Pact is based on the objective of sound government finances as a means of strengthening the conditions for price stability and for strong sustainable growth conducive to employment creation.
annotations.translation: (2) 《稳定与增长公约》基于健全政府财政的目标，是加强价格稳定和强劲、可持续增长的条件，有利于创造就业机会。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (3) The excessive deficit procedure under Article 104 provides for a decision on the existence of an excessive deficit and the Protocol on the excessive deficit procedure annexed to the Treaty sets out further provisions relating to the implementation of the excessive deficit procedure. Council Regulation (EC) No 3605/93 of 22 November 1993 on the application of the Protocol on the excessive deficit procedure annexed to the Treaty establishing the European Community(¹), lays down detailed rules and definitions for the application of the provision of the said Protocol.
annotations.translation: (3) 第 104 条规定的过度赤字程序规定了对是否存在过度赤字作出决定，《条约》所附的过度赤字程序议定书规定了与执行过度赤字程序有关的进一步规定。1993 年 11 月 22 日关于适用《建立欧洲共同体条约》(¹) 所附过度赤字程序议定书的 (EC) 理事会第 3605/93 号条例规定了适用该议定书条款的细则和定义。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (4) Article 104(5) of the Treaty requires the Commission to address an opinion to the Council if the Commission considers that an excessive deficit in a Member State exists or may occur. Having examined all relevant factors taken into account in its report in accordance with Article 104(3) and having regard to the opinion of the Economic and Financial Committee in accordance with Article 104(4), the Commission concluded in its opinion of 24 June 2004 that there exists an excessive deficit in Poland.
annotations.translation: (4)《条约》第 104(5) 条要求，如果委员会认为某成员国存在或可能出现过度赤字时，应向理事会提出意见。委员会根据第 104(3) 条审查了报告中考虑的所有相关因素，并考虑了经济和金融委员会根据第 104(4) 条提出的意见，在 2004 年 6 月 24 日的意见中得出了波兰存在过度赤字的结论。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (5) Article 104(6) of the Treaty lays down that the Council should consider any observations which the Member State concerned may wish to make before deciding, after an overall assessment, whether an excessive deficit exists.
annotations.translation: (5)《条约》第 104(6) 条规定，理事会在全面评估后决定是否存在过度赤字之前，应考虑有关成员国可能希望提出的任何意见。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (6) The overall assessment leads to the following conclusions: the general government deficit reached 4,1% of GDP in 2003 in Poland, above the 3% of GDP Treaty reference value. The excess of the general government deficit over the reference value did not result from an unusual event outside the control of the Polish authorities, nor was it the result of a severe economic downturn, in the sense of the Stability and Growth Pact. The general government deficit is likely to remain above 3% of GDP in 2004. In particular, according to the Commission Spring 2004 forecasts, the deficit is projected to reach 6% of GDP in 2004, while the convergence programme of Poland expects a deficit of 5,7% of GDP. The debt ratio, which was 45,4% in 2003, is likely to remain below the 60% of GDP Treaty reference value in 2004. The deficit and the debt figures will have to be adjusted upward if the open pension funds are excluded from the general government sector following the Eurostat decision on the classification of the funded pension schemes,
annotations.translation: (6) 总体评估得出以下结论：2003 年波兰政府总赤字达到 GDP 的 4.1%，高于《条约》参考值 3%。政府总赤字超过参考值并不是由于波兰政府无法控制的异常事件造成的，也不是由于《稳定与增长公约》所指的严重经济衰退造成的。2004 年，政府总赤字可能仍保持在 GDP 的 3% 以上。特别是，根据委员会 2004 年春季的预测，2004 年赤字预计将达到 GDP 的 6%，而波兰的趋同方案预计赤字将达到 GDP 的 5.7%。2003 年的债务比率为 45.4%，2004 年可能仍低于《条约》规定的参考值， GDP 的 60%。如果根据欧统局关于注资养老金计划的分类的决定，将开放式养老金基金排除在一般政府部门之外，则赤字和债务数字就必须向上调整，

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: HAS ADOPTED THIS DECISON:

annotations.label: Section-header
annotations.text: Article 1

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: From an overall assessment it follows that an excessive deficit exists in Poland.
annotations.translation: 从总体评估来看，波兰存在过度赤字。

annotations.label: Section-header
annotations.text: Article 2

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: This decision is addressed to the Republic of Poland.
annotations.translation: 本决定的对象是波兰共和国。

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: Done at Brussels, 5 July 2004.
annotations.translation: 2004 年 7 月 5 日订于布鲁塞尔。

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: For the Council

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: The President

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: G. ZALM

annotations.label: Footnote
annotations.text: (¹) OJ L 332, 31.12.1993, p. 7. Regulation as last amended by Commission Regulation (EC) No 351/2002 (OJ L 55, 26.2.2002, p. 23).
annotations.translation: (¹) OJ L 332，1993 年 12 月 31 日，第 7 页。经委员会 (EC) 第 351/2002 号条例（OJ L 55，2002 年 2 月 26 日，第 23 页）最后修正的条例。
